column4: Anyone awake? Heh. I need a little help here, I'm really new to Ubuntu and Linux in general. I just installed 6.06, but there's a little problem. My laptop has a 15" Widescreen, but the only resolution options are for 5:4 Monitors. I'd like to use 1280x800, any ideas?
Errr... Do you guys know of any tutorials for that? I'm really new to Linux, not familiar with any commands or anything...
Plenty of time (and a kitten for throwing against a wall sometimes)
Do you know how to do that?
Are you on Ubuntu (Gnome) or Kubuntu (KDE)?
So try to open a terminal (there must be a menu entry)
Now your command prompt should have changed from "$" to "#".
look for a line taht ends with "universe" and remove the "#" at the beginning
Stop. While you were searching I looked it up and found that editing of sources.list  is not nesseccary for ATI.
So let's interrup step 1 by pressing F2 for closing the editor nano and say "No" to saving any changes.
I found this wiki that should help you: http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Edgy_Installation_Guide
